fields.description: I created an image from snapshot to test search by owner on Images Landing Page. When I used the "Owner: me " filter, the search returned an empty page. I marked this bug critical, because search by owner is likely to be popular among users. Movie of the test included.
fields.summary: Search by owner on images landing page does not filter correctly

comments.body: may be fixed by EUCA-7736, should re-test after that code merges.
[~alice] 7736 was just merged to testing, can you re-test this one please?

I just pulled from testing and this does appear to be broken. [~eans] is out of cycles but knows what the fix is here and says it is easy, [~eans] can you please comment in this ticket? [~jpommer] has cycles today and can fix this if you let him know. We should fix this.
I've noticed it is broken for owner=me when logged into AWS. I think we need facet values for owner to be "amazon" and "me".
I just updated to the latest packages, and search by owner:me  works, but there are no "drop-down" options  offered.
The search needs to be for "ownerId" instead of owner. There is no field "owner".
Sounds good, as long as what's user-facing still says owner... and uses "me" and "Amazon" as facets instead of IDs...
For me selecting the owner facet and populating "me" or "amazon" works in EUCA-7809. David and I addressed some speed issues in the tag search, which seems to be the real problem.
Per [~eans]'s comments, the fixes for this are in EUCA-7809, which is pending review.
Fixed as part of the work in 7809,  pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/139

[~kedwards], can we assign this to someone with better image creation/upload skills than myself? Perhaps [~alice], since she has already created an image and can upload it easily? It will take me forever with probably lots of disrupting others for help to verify this fix. I could verify a bajillion others in the same amount of time. Assigning to [~kedwards] for reassignment to someone else.
[~alice] [~kedwards] Are we sure this is fixed? I could reproduce on FF on the latest testing branch.
Hi [~spark], I tested it on my POC setup, and did not see it. Please re-open if you could reproduce it. Are you testing on multi-cluster?
[~neil], [~kedwards]: I haven't been able to implement a quick fix for this one, and we need to focus on EUCA-7828, so looks like we're going to log this as a KI for 3.4.0
Added to the known issues list for 3.4 for DOC-1044. If a workaround (or a fix) happens, please reopen that bug.
[~scottb]: The fix for EUCA-7823 will resolve this issue, once it's verified by QA.
